name: preadaptation
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the possession by living things of characteristics that could help them to do well in a new environment, or one of these characteristics: This trait in the beetle is probably a preadaptation for becoming a pest of stored beans. The concept of preadaptation accounts for this type of evolution. The adaptations these species already possess for harsh temperate environments become pre-adaptations for polar living.
More examplesFewer examplesMosses and lichens have many preadaptations for polar life.
